channel.title: Any welders in here?
channel.description: Just curious. Are there any welders here? If there are, what do you do? Or if anybody has welded at home, what did you do?

item.title: Any welders in here?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Chrix, post:5, topic:535259”]I do a little welding in my business as a c-7 licensed low voltage electrician, usually i do hinges on structural gates for country clubs or residential jobs. I am currently working on getting my ornamental license so I can weld pedestrian as well as structural gates. As soon as I can get a few pictures uploaded I will.[/quote]Ornamental license? I’ve never heard of that before.

Read full topic

item.title: Any welders in here?

I do a little welding in my business as a c-7 licensed low voltage electrician, usually i do hinges on structural gates for country clubs or residential jobs. I am currently working on getting my ornamental license so I can weld pedestrian as well as structural gates. As soon as I can get a few pictures uploaded I will.

item.title: Any welders in here?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

What welder are you using? Is this your first time? The fabrication of some of the panels looks spot on, the welds not so much. Pic 8-10 is close enough for me to see the weld profile. Those beads look a little like you’re jumping or going too fast. If I were you, I’d tack those panels in place first, then if you want to reinforce it, you can drop a pass on it. Tacking the panels is strong enough, and it won’t put a lot of heat in the metal causing it to distort, which you’ve probably noticed after a couple passes.

Read full topic
